content.question: Which of the following statements supports the claim that the Fugitive Slave Act of 1850 encouraged abolitionist sympathies in the North?

choices.label: Most Northern states continued to restrict the rights of African American residents, including barring them from voting in elections.
Free African Americans living in Northern cities formed mutual-aid societies and Black churches to help them build stronger communities.
Northern state governments usually complied with southerners’ legal requests for the arrest and return of formerly enslaved persons under the Fugitive Slave Act.
Underground Railroad activists such as Harriet Tubman, who relied on northerners’ support, continued and often expanded their operations after 1850.

content.answer: Underground Railroad activists such as Harriet Tubman, who relied on northerners’ support, continued and often expanded their operations after 1850.
